customer_name: Dolphins Plus Oceanside Marine Mammal Responder

citations.narrative:
On April 12, 2023, two dolphins, “Bob” and “Alfonz”, were performing a dorsal tow encounter that resulted in a guest
receiving bites on his left ankle and right thigh. The guest was treated for superficial cuts and refused further medical
attention.
On June 12, 2023, a guest was participating in a pole jump encounter in deep water. During this encounter, guests hold
the end of a floating pole as a dolphin jumps over it. A dolphin named “Dinghy” jumped diagonally over the pole and hit a
guest with her rostrum. The guest was treated at the facility for bleeding and elected to receive additional medical
treatment.
Inadequate handling or control of animals during public interactions can lead to injury of the public and the animals.
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public. To
be corrected from this day, August 24, 2023, forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(c)(1)  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
On April 12, 2023, two dolphins, “Bob” and “Alfonz”, were performing a dorsal tow encounter that resulted in a guest 
receiving bites on his left ankle and right thigh. The guest was treated for superficial cuts and refused further medical 
attention. 
 
On June 12, 2023, a guest was participating in a pole jump encounter in deep water. During this encounter, guests hold 
the end of a floating pole as a dolphin jumps over it. A dolphin named “Dinghy” jumped diagonally over the pole and hit a 
guest with her rostrum. The guest was treated at the facility for bleeding and elected to receive additional medical 
treatment. 
 
Inadequate handling or control of animals during public interactions can lead to injury of the public and the animals. 
 
During public exhibition, any animal must be handled so there is minimal risk of harm to the animal and to the public. To 
be corrected from this day, August 24, 2023, forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Eduardo Vivas, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
